intro: Englerina swynnertonii, commonly known as the Swynnerton's englerina, is a rare and unusual plant species native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many milkweed-like plants. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, often hairy, yellowish-green leaves and clusters of small, pinkish flowers. It is typically found in rocky or sandy soils in arid or semi-arid regions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
